page.title: 19MONXTON VILLAGE HALL.
page.content: The present brick Village Hall occupies the same site by the bridge as its wooden predecessor and was built in 1967. It is owned by the parish of Monxton. The Management Committee consists of three Parish Council and twelve committee members. The Hall is self-financed by its lettings. A typical week's lettings are: Monday - Yoga: Tuesday - Play- group & monthly Open House: Wednesday - Youth Club, Playgroup & Badminton: Thursday - Playgroup & monthly Women's Institute. Friday, Saturday & Sunday have no permanent bookings. It is let for Wedding Receptions, Parties, Fund Raising Functions, Meetings, Polling, Local Government & Parish Council Meetings. At Christmas it is transformed by local groups staging pantomimes and festive functions. A well-used Village Hall.
